comments.body: Hm.. dose pep8 has a different argument location rule for class and function? It seems this one is already fine and seems inconsistent with https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/14830/files#diff-82fe155d22aaaf433e949193d262c736R43
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -65,8 +67,9 @@
     predictions.select("prediction", "indexedLabel", "features").show(5)
 
     # Select (prediction, true label) and compute test error
-    evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(
-        labelCol="indexedLabel", predictionCol="prediction", metricName="accuracy")

comments.body:
`pep8` tool does this automatically if line is > 100 char. There is indeed no preference between this format and:

    evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(labelCol="indexedLabel",
                                                  predictionCol="prediction",
                                                  metricName="accuracy")

I would say both are equivalent. I tend to prefere this one (the latter)
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -65,8 +67,9 @@
     predictions.select("prediction", "indexedLabel", "features").show(5)
 
     # Select (prediction, true label) and compute test error
-    evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(
-        labelCol="indexedLabel", predictionCol="prediction", metricName="accuracy")
